content:
Hi @CÃ©sar Ferreira I just realized we have https://gitlab.com/lip-computing/dataverse listed under "prior containerization efforts" at https://ct.gdcc.io

What would be a more accurate term? Competing? Parallel? You don't re-use the gdcc images, do you?
We have repositories for our Dataverse and Solr images, that are a bit outdated but will probably be updated soon.

Ok, thanks. I feel like "prior" implies that it's inactive. We should come up with a term to mean ongoing. Two lists is fine: prior vs. parallel (or whatever term).

Relates to this: Document competing containerization efforts and how to chooseÂ #10522
